content:
🌍 MARKET NEWS RECAP

Global financial markets were largely closed for the New Year's Day holiday, severely limiting major index trading in the US and Europe. The $S&P 500 and $Euro Stoxx saw no activity, with attention shifting to overnight commodity moves. The $Shanghai Composite, however, provided a final data point, managing a slight gain, closing up 0.1% at 3,968.84. Gold prices remain a macro focus after recording an astonishing annual gain of approximately 64% in 2025, while oil prices ended the year down nearly 20%.

💼 PORTFOLIO FOCUS

The AI/Semiconductor complex, including $NVDA and $TSM, is poised for a strong start to 2026 following reports that $NVDA is ramping up production for its H200 AI chips in a dramatic push to meet Chinese orders exceeding 2 million units for the year. Broader AI-driven demand for high-bandwidth memory chips is expected to accelerate a supply crunch, potentially driving consumer electronics prices up by 5% to 20% in 2026. 🌍 MARKET NEWS RECAP

US markets began the new year with a strong open, as $S&P 500 futures rose 0.52% and $Nasdaq 100 futures surged 0.92% early in the session, supported by a stronger-than-expected labor market report showing US initial unemployment claims unexpectedly fell to a one-month low. Asia saw a significant rally on the first trading day, with Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index jumping over 2.5% driven by a surge in technology and AI-related stocks. European indexes opened mostly higher, though $Euro Stoxx 50 futures indicated a weaker start for the region.

💼 PORTFOLIO FOCUS

The AI and Chip sector is dominating the new year's open, providing a tailwind for major holdings like $NVDA, $AVGO, $TSM, $MSFT, $SNPS, $AMZN, and $GOOG, as a regional technology gauge rose to a record high on strong investor optimism. The tech-heavy $IQQL.DE ETF is benefiting directly from this strength, while other holdings like $PLTR and $NET will track the broader internet and cloud infrastructure sentime

🌍 MARKET NEWS RECAP

Global markets kicked off the new year with a broad risk-on rally, led by a strong resurgence in technology and growth stocks. US indices rebounded from a four-day losing streak, with the $Nasdaq Composite jumping over 1% and the $S&P 500 gaining about 0.5% in early trading. European equities hit a fresh record high, as the pan-European $Euro Stoxx 600 climbed 0.6% and the UK's FTSE 100 surpassed the symbolic 10,000 level for the first time. While Mainland China markets were closed, the Hong Kong Hang Seng Index (HSI) soared 2.76%, driven by renewed optimism in the domestic AI sector.

💼 PORTFOLIO FOCUS

The Healthcare sector saw major catalysts as $NOVO-B.CO surged 4.5% following positive Phase 2 trial data for its experimental weight-loss/diabetes drug, amycretin. $AZN.L also gained 2% after its drug Imfinzi received US approval for use in combination therapy for early-stage gastric and gastroesophageal junction cancers. 🌍 MARKET NEWS RECAP

**1. 🌍 MARKET OVERVIEW**

Global markets began the new year with a broad risk-on rally, driven by optimism over AI and technology stocks as US markets reopened after the holiday. The $Nasdaq and $S&P 500 futures signaled a strong open, up 0.92% and 0.52% respectively, with US indices continuing that momentum in early trading. European indices surged, with the $FTSE 100 hitting an intraday record after crossing the 10,000 mark for the first time, while the $DAX and $CAC 40 gained around 0.5% to 0.8%. Trading in Mainland China ($Shanghai Composite) was closed, but the Hong Kong $Hang Seng Index jumped over 2.6% on a strong rally in local tech shares.

**2. 💼 PORTFOLIO FOCUS**

The AI and semiconductor complex led the charge, with major holdings like $NVDA and $GOOG climbing more than 2% in early trading, fueling the strong performance of tech-focused ETFs like $IQQL.DE. The European rally provided an immediate tailwind for $IEUR, while the $FTSE 100’s record high was

🌍 MARKET NEWS RECAP

Global markets saw a mixed and volatile start to the new year, with US indices giving up early gains to close lower while European markets continued their rally. The $S&P 500 fell -0.74% and the $Nasdaq 100 lost -0.84%, sliding to 1.5-week lows on weakness in megacap technology stocks and rising bond yields. US initial unemployment claims unexpectedly fell to a one-month low of 199,000, which drove the 10-year Treasury yield higher, acting as a headwind for equities. Conversely, the $Euro Stoxx 50 rallied to a new all-time high, with the $FTSE 100 also hitting an intraday record, buoyed by broad optimism. In Asia, China's December Manufacturing PMI rose to 50.1, signaling the fastest expansion in nine months, though the $Shanghai Composite saw only a marginal gain of +0.09%.

💼 PORTFOLIO FOCUS

The AI and Semiconductor space was highly volatile; chip makers like $NVDA and $GOOG initially surged over 2% on AI optimism, but this was offset by a late-day pullback. Meg
